Text.Page:
You must help me, ! I need you...I need you to poison me!

Wait, don't go! I can explain. I need to be poisoned by a {@LinkCreature:30#140#venomous tentacullar} right away."By the titans, why?"

I have a dark secretâ€”something truly important that I cannot reveal to anyone. Alais and the goons from the Mysterium are going to force it out of me. The right dose of {@LinkCreature:30#140#venomous tentacullar} poison acts on the brain and causes memory loss. I'd rather be forgetful than dead.
Thank you so much, <PCNAME>. Please, give it to me now!<NEXTPAGEBUTTON>"Here's the poison."</NEXTPAGEBUTTON>

(He chugs the poison in the bottle and then opens and closes his mouth several times, increasingly panic-stricken.)

(He points to his mouth, gesticulates wildly, and then points to another miner.)
I will not tell the secret even if those goons torture me. I'd rather be dead.

He drank what? No wonder he can't speak.

His throat will swell to the point where he'll have trouble breathing for days. What happened?"He was trying to forget a big secret..."

That old wives' tale about tentacullar venom? He won't forget the past, but he won't be able to give up his precious secret, either.

Somebody has to tell {@LinkCreature:230#1065$$Libinienn} about this.

We miners have an old custom, called "one-two-three-not-it," so you get to go tell Libinienn how you poisoned one of the miners.

Good luck with that, .

So you gave him tentacullar venom. And he drank it.

I...I...words fail me."I was just trying to help."

You'll do anything someone asks you to do, eh?

You want to know what his big secret is? He's been taking some of our finds from the dig site and hiding them for black-market confederates to pick up.

And you delayed the interrogation he so richly deserves!"I'm sorry."

Well, you're naive, but you're no criminal.

And come to think of it, you probably punished him worse by poisoning him than I would have.

When you're an itinerant miner, getting sentenced to hard labor isn't much of a punishment.
